Photographs showing objects resembling s: 2. The claimant, Jensen Karp, confirmed purchasing the box of cereal from a specific location and provided details about the contents of the box, including the presence of shrimp tails, string, and other foreign objects.
The cereal company: General Mills, was contacted by Snopes but did not respond to the inquiry regarding the alleged contamination.
A crustacean researcher: Adam Wall, expressed his intention to analyze the objects under a microscope to determine if they were indeed shrimp tails or simply accumulations of cinnamon and sugar.
